unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, evaluate and deploy a broad range of grammatical structures of Russian at intermediate level.
Develop comprehensive intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Russian language.
Create meaningful intercultural encounters by applying relevant language conventions.
Identify, describe and evaluate a broad range of aspects of Russian-speaking cultures and societies.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Russian and in English.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and language practice. Students should be familiar with and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week. Seminar preparation time also includes time to study, revise tutorial content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

assessments.description: For the oral test, students have to prepare a three-minute talk on a topic of their choice. Students will be assessed on their presentation, as well as their ability to answer follow-up questions. This will be a part of regular seminar time. Online students will do this task via Zoom.

Active participation to set activities is required for all students. Students will be expected to have revised the course materials and engage with the activities set out in the iLearn unit on a regular basis.
The purpose of the test is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learned throughout the semester. This test will be conducted online.

The purpose of the test is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn throughout the semester. This will be a part of regular seminar time. External students will engage with this task online.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Attendance for exam only
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: In this unit students develop their ability to follow complex lines of argument in spoken and written texts in Russian in a range of genres and to identify and extract key information. The unit focuses on practicing skills in expressing and defending sophisticated arguments and opinions and employing strategies to understand and respond to unfamiliar material in preparation for applying language knowledge to social and professional situations. Students will use their judgement in decision-making around communicative tasks (written, oral, spontaneous and prepared) in meaningful everyday contexts.
data.title: C Russian Studies 6
